text: basic example shows use API:

title: FlashText Algorithm for Finding and Replacing Words
code: library(rflashtext)  processor <- KeywordProcessor$new(keys = c("NY", "LA"), words = c("New York", "Los Angeles")) processor$show_trie() #> [1] "{\"L\":{\"A\":{\"_word_\":\"Los Angeles\"}},\"N\":{\"Y\":{\"_word_\":\"New York\"}}}"

title: FlashText Algorithm for Finding and Replacing Words
code: processor$add_keys_words(keys = c("TX", "CA"), words = c("Texas", "California")) processor$show_trie() #> [1] "{\"C\":{\"A\":{\"_word_\":\"California\"}},\"L\":{\"A\":{\"_word_\":\"Los Angeles\"}},\"N\":{\"Y\":{\"_word_\":\"New York\"}},\"T\":{\"X\":{\"_word_\":\"Texas\"}}}"

title: FlashText Algorithm for Finding and Replacing Words
code: words_found <- processor$find_keys(sentences = c("I live in LA and I like NY", "Have you been in TX?")) words_found #> [[1]] #> [[1]]$word #> [1] "Los Angeles" "New York"    #>  #> [[1]]$start #> [1] 11 25 #>  #> [[1]]$end #> [1] 12 26 #>  #>  #> [[2]] #> [[2]]$word #> [1] "Texas" #>  #> [[2]]$start #> [1] 18 #>  #> [[2]]$end #> [1] 19 data.table::rbindlist(words_found) #>           word start end #> 1: Los Angeles    11  12 #> 2:    New York    25  26 #> 3:       Texas    18  19
